hypothesis_content.title: Post-Liquidity Crash Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: After October's severe liquidity crash, the subsequent consolidation has created abnormally suppressed volatility. The first expansion of aggregate stablecoin supply by >2% will trigger a directional volatility breakout exceeding 1.5x the 20-day ATR within 3 days, with direction biased toward the prevailing regime's momentum.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Severe liquidity drains (like October's crash) create 'volatility vacuums.' The return of liquidity (stablecoin minting) acts as a catalyst to fill this vacuum. In a NEUTRAL/BULL regime, the breakout is likely upward; in BEAR, downward. The suppressed volatility provides a favorable risk/reward for a volatility expansion trade.
entry_conditions: Aggregate crypto volatility index (e.g., BVOL, CVOL) hits 20-day low (bottom quartile)
Total stablecoin supply (USDT+USDC+DAI) shows 3-day net change > +2%
BTC 20-day Average True Range (ATR) as % of price < 1.8%

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price moves 1.5x the 20-day ATR from entry point
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Volatility remains compressed (ATR% < 1.5%) for 5 days post-entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If stablecoin supply increase fails to trigger any significant volatility expansion, or if volatility expands randomly without directional follow-through.
